src: Ano! Král Tutanchamón, někdy zmiňovaný také jako „Král Tut“ nebo „Král chlapec“, je jedním ze v současnosti nejznámějších starověkých egyptských králů. Je zajímavé, že ve starověku nebyl považován za příliš významného a na většině královských seznamů nebyl uveden. Objev jeho hrobky v roce 1922 z něj nicméně udělal celebritu. Zatímco mnoho hrobů bylo vykradeno, tato hrobka zůstala prakticky neporušená. Většina předmětů pochovaných s Tutanchamonem byla dobře zachována, včetně tisíců artefaktů vyrobených ze vzácných kovů a drahokamů.
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "Boy King", is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings. It is interesting that in ancient times he was not considered very important and was not listed on most royal lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs were looted, this tomb remained practically undisturbed. Most of the objects buried with Tutankhamun were well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and gemstones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Známe mnoho řeckých politiků, vědců a umělců. Asi nejznámější osobností této kultury je Homér, legendární slepý básník, který je autorem dvou mistrovských děl řecké literatury: eposů Illias a Odyssea. Sofoklés a Aristofanés jsou stále populárními autory a jejich hry jsou považovány za jedny z největších děl světové literatury. Dalším slavným Řekem je matematik Pythagoras, známý především pro svoji proslulou tezi o vztazích stran pravoúhlých trojúhelníků.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. The most famous person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who is the author of two masterpieces of Greek literature: the epics Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular authors and their plays are considered to be one of the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, known mainly for his famous theorem about the relationships of the sides of right triangles.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: V teplém klimatu Blízkého východu nebyl dům tolik důležitý. Většina života hebrejské rodiny se odehrávala pod širým nebem. Ženy vařily na dvorku; obchody byly pouze otevřené pulty směřující do ulice. Na stavbu domů se používal kámen. V zemi Kanaán se nevyskytovaly žádné rozsáhlé lesy, takže dřevo bylo velmi drahé.
mt: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family took place outdoors. Women cooked in the courtyard; shops were only open counters facing the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no extensive forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was very expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: Grónsko bylo osídlováno řídce. V severských ságách se píše, že Erik Rudý byl z Islandu vyhoštěn za vraždu, a když cestoval dál na západ, našel Grónsko a pojmenoval jej Zelená země. Nehledě na jeho nález už tam tehdy žily kmeny Eskymáků. Přestože byly všechny země součástí „Skandinávie“, mezi obyvateli, králi, zvyky a dějinami Dánska, Švédska, Norska a Islandu existovalo mnoho rozdílů.
mt: Grönland was sparsely populated. In the Norse sagas it is written that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when he traveled further west, he found Greenland and named it the Green Land. Despite his discovery, Eskimo tribes already lived there. Although all the lands were part of "Scandinavia", there were many differences between the inhabitants, kings, customs and histories of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Zatímco většina z jejich jídel by nám nebyla cizí, Římané měli svůj podíl na zvláštních nebo neobvyklých složeních hostin, zahrnujíc divočáka, páva, hlemýždě a druh hlodavce nazývaného plch. Dalším rozdílem bylo, že ženy a chudí lidé jedli své jídlo vsedě na židlích, zatímco bohatí muži rádi  pořádali hostiny společně a při jídle polehávali na boku. Starověká římská jídla nemohla zahrnovat potraviny, které se dostaly do Evropy z Ameriky nebo z Asie až v pozdějších stoletích. Neměli například kukuřici, rajčata, brambory ani kakao a žádný starověký Říman nikdy neochutnal krocana.
mt: While most of their meals would be familiar to us, the Romans had their share of unusual or exotic dishes, including boar, peacock, snail and a rodent called the dormouse. Another difference was that women and poor people ate their food sitting down on chairs, while rich men liked to host banquets together and while eating they reclined on their sides. Ancient Roman meals could not include foods that came to Europe from the Americas or Asia until later centuries. They did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes or cocoa and no ancient Roman ever tasted chicken.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Civilizace je určitá kultura, společná významné rozsáhlé skupině lidí, kteří žijí a pracují ve vzájemné kooperaci, tj. dohromady tvoří společnost. Slovo civilizace pochází z latinského „civilis“, což znamená „civilní“ a souvisí to s latinským „civis“, což znamená „občan“ a také „civitas“, což znamená město nebo městský stát a zároveň to jistým způsobem definuje velikost společnosti. Předchůdci národů byly městské státy. Kultura civilizace se vyznačuje předáváním znalostí po dobu několika generací, přítomností dlouhotrvajících kulturních stop a přiměřeným šířením. Drobné kultury často mizí, aniž by zanechaly relevantní historické důkazy a nejsou uznány za řádné civilizace.
mt: A civilization is a certain culture, common to a significant large group of people, who live and work together in mutual cooperation, i.e. together form a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin "civilis", which means "civil" and is related to the Latin "civis", which means "citizen" and also "civitas", which means city or city-state and at the same time in some way defines the size of the society. The predecessors of nations were city-states. The culture of civilization is characterized by the transmission of knowledge over several generations, the presence of long-lasting cultural traces and appropriate spread. Small cultures often disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and are not recognized as proper civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong je zřícenina pevnosti a buddhistického kláštera, která se nachází v horní části okresu Paro (ve vesnici Phondey). Říká se, že tuto pevnost založil v roce 1649 Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel pro připomínku svého vítězství nad tibetsko-mongolskými silami. Po požáru pevnosti Drukgyel Dzong v roce 1951 zbyly pouze některé relikvie, jako například obraz Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Po požáru byla pevnost zachována a chráněna, takže zůstala jednou z nejsenzačnějších atrakcí Bhútánu.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is the ruins of a fortress and Buddhist monastery, located in the upper part of the Paro district (in the village of Phondey). It is said that this fortress was founded in 1649 by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel to commemorate his victory over Tibetan-Mongolian forces. After the fire of Drukgyel Dzong in 1951, only some relics remained, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, so it remained one of the most famous attractions of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: V průběhu 18. století byla Kambodža sevřena mezi dvěma mocnými sousedy, Thajskem a Vietnamem. Thajci napadli Kambodžu několikrát v 18. století a v roce 1772 zničili Phnompenh. V posledních letech 18. století také Vietnamci napadli Kambodžu.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was sandwiched between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais attacked Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also attacked Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: V průběhu 18. století byla Kambodža sevřena mezi dvěma mocnými sousedy, Thajskem a Vietnamem. Thajci napadli Kambodžu několikrát v 18. století a v roce 1772 zničili Phnompenh. V posledních letech 18. století také Vietnamci napadli Kambodžu.

src: Počátky Taiwanu se datují až do 15. století, kdy poblíž proplouvající evropští námořníci zaznamenali jméno ostrova jako Ilha Formosa, tedy krásný ostrov. V roce 1624 holandská Východoindická společnost vytváří základnu v jihozápadním Taiwanu a zahajuje tím přeměnu původních praktik produkce obilí, přičemž zaměstnává čínské dělníky na svých rýžových a cukrových plantážích. V roce 1683 převzaly jednotky dynastie Čching (1644–1912) vládu nad jihozápadním a severním pobřežím Tchaj-wanu a v roce 1885 byl Tchaj-wan prohlášen za provincii Říše Čching. Roku 1895, po porážce v první čínsko-japonské válce (1894–1895), podepsala čchingská vláda Šimonoseckou mírovou smlouvu, na jejímž základě předala svrchovanost nad Tchaj-wanem Japonsku. To vládlo tomuto ostrovu až do roku 1945.
mt: Taiwan's history begins in the 15th century, when European sailors passing by the island noted its name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan and began transforming the island's original rice-growing practices, employing Chinese laborers on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644–1912) forces took control of southwestern and northern Taiwan's coastlines, and in 1885, Taiwan was declared a province of the Qing Empire. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894–1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded Taiwan to Japan. Japan ruled Taiwan until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Tomu se říká hodnota pH chemikálie. Můžete si sami vytvořit indikátor pomocí džusu z červeného zelí. Šťáva ze zelí mění barvu podle toho, jak je chemikálie kyselá nebo zásaditá (alkalická). Hodnota pH se určuje podle množství iontů vodíku (písmeno H v pH) v testované chemikálii. Vodíkové ionty jsou protony, jimž byly odebrány elektrony (protože atomy vodíku se skládají z jednoho protonu a jednoho elektronu).
mt: This is called the pH of the chemical. You can make your own indicator using red cabbage juice. Juice from red cabbage changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH is determined by the amount of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons, which have had electrons removed (because hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Lvi jsou nejspolečenštější kočky, žijí ve velkých skupinách zvaných smečky. Smečku tvoří jeden až tři příbuzní dospělí samci spolu s až třiceti samicemi a mláďaty. Samice jsou obvykle blízce příbuzné a představují velkou rodinu tvořenou sestrami a dcerami. Lví smečka se chová podobně jako smečka vlků nebo psů, zvířat překvapivě podobných lvům (ale ne jiným velkým kočkám) v chování, a také velmi smrtící pro svou kořist.
mt: Lions are the most social of cats, living in large groups called prides. A pride consists of one to three closely related adult males with up to thirty females and their cubs. Females are usually closely related and form a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides behave similarly to wolf or dog packs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other large cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Pod nimi jsou středně velké kočkovité šelmy, jejichž potravu tvoří středně velká kořist, od králíků po antilopy a jeleny. Nakonec je tu spousta malých koček (včetně volně žijících koček domácích), jejichž hlavní podíl stravy tvoří drobná kořist jako hmyz, hlodavci, plazi a ptáci. Tajemství jejich úspěchu spočívá na systému ekologických nik, tzn. že každá kočka má své vlastní úkoly, které jí nedovolují konkurovat ostatním.
mt: Beneath them are medium-sized cat-like predators, whose diet consists of medium-sized prey, from rabbits to antelope and deer. Eventually there are plenty of small cats (including free-ranging domestic cats), whose main share of the diet consists of small prey such as insects, rodents, reptiles and birds. The secret of their success lies in a system of ecological niches, i.e. that each cat has its own tasks that do not allow it to compete with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Oceloti rádi jedí malá zvířata. Pokud mají možnost, chytají opice, hady, hlodavce a ptáky. Skoro všechna zvířata, která ocelot loví, jsou mnohem menší než on sám. Vědci se domnívají, že oceloti sledují a nacházejí zvířata k snědku (kořist) podle pachu, kdy očicháním poznají, kudy po zemi se pohybovali. V noci vidí velmi dobře díky nočnímu vidění a dokážou se pohybovat velmi tiše. Oceloti loví tak, že splynou se svým okolím a poté na svou kořist skočí.
mt: Ocelots love to eat small animals. If they have the opportunity, they catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds. Almost all animals that ocelots hunt are much smaller than themselves. Scientists believe that ocelots track and find prey by scent, when sniffing they can recognize where the animals have moved along the ground. At night they see very well thanks to night vision and can move very quietly. Ocelots hunt by blending in with their surroundings and then pounce on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Tygr dokáže šplhat (i když ne dobře), plavat, skákat na velké vzdálenosti a tahat s pětkrát větší silou než silný člověk. Tygr patří do stejného rodu (genus panthera) jako lvi, levharti a jaguáři. Tyto čtyři kočky jsou jediné, které umějí řvát. Tygří řev není jako řev lva z plného hrdla, ale spíše jako věta ostrých, zakřičených slov.
mt: Tigers can climb (though not well), swim, jump long distances and pull with five times the strength of a strong man. Tigers belong to the same genus (genus panthera) as lions, leopards and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. A tiger's roar is not like a lion's roar from a full throat, but rather like a string of sharp, barked words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

Tigers belong to the same genus (genus panthera) as lions, leopards and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. A tiger's roar is not like a lion's roar from a full throat, but rather like a string of sharp, barked words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Buňka je nejmenší strukturální a funkční jednotkou živých organismů. Anglický výraz pro buňku pochází z latinského slova cella, což znamená malý pokoj. Pokud se na živé věci podíváte pod mikroskopem, uvidíte, že se skládají z drobných čtverečků nebo kuliček. Anglický biolog Robert Hooke viděl v korku mikroskopem malé čtverce. Vypadaly jako místnosti. Byl první osobou, která kdy spatřila mrtvé buňky
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of living organisms. The word cell comes from the Latin word cella meaning small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or spheres. English biologist Robert Hooke saw small squares in cork under a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to ever see dead cells
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Zvířata jsou tvořena spoustou buněk. Jedí věci a uvnitř je tráví. Většina zvířat se může hýbat. Mozek mají pouze živočichové (i když to neplatí pro všechny živočichy: například medúzy mozek nemají). Zvířata se nacházejí po celé zemi. Prohrabávají se zeminou, plavou v oceánech a létají po obloze.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though this doesn't apply to all animals: for example, jellyfish don't have brains). Animals are found all over the world. They burrow in the ground, swim in the oceans and fly through the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Rostliny produkují kyslík, který lidé dýchají, a přijímají oxid uhličitý, který lidé vydechují. Rostliny si vyrábějí výživu ze slunce prostřednictvím fotosyntézy. Také poskytují stín. Vyrábíme naše domy a oblečení z rostlin. Většina potravin, které jíme, jsou rostlinné původu. Bez rostlin by zvířata nemohla přežít.
mt: Plants produce oxygen, which people breathe, and take in carbon dioxide, which people exhale. Plants make their own food from the sun through photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our homes and clothing from plants. Most of the food we eat is plant-based. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Když se malá skupina živočichů (malá populace) oddělí od hlavní populace, ze které pochází (například když přejdou horský hřeben či řeku nebo se přesunou na nový ostrov, ze kterého není snadné dostat se zpět), často se ocitnou v odlišném prostředí, než v jakém byli předtím. Toto nové prostředí má různé zdroje a různé konkurenty, takže nová populace bude potřebovat jiné vlastnosti nebo způsoby adaptace, aby se stala silnějším konkurentem než v minulosti. Původní populace se vůbec nezměnila, stále potřebují stejné adaptace jako předtím. Postupem času, jak se nová populace přizpůsobuje svému novému prostředí, začínají vypadat méně a méně jako ostatní populace. Nakonec, za několik tisíc nebo dokonce milionů let, budou tyto dvě populace natolik odlišné, že je již nebude možné považovat za stejný druh. Tento proces nazýváme speciace, což znamená vznik nových druhů. Speciace je nevyhnutelným následkem a velmi důležitou součástí evoluce.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) separates from the main population from which it came (for example, when they cross a mountain ridge or river or move to a new island from which it is difficult to return), they often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different traits or ways of adapting to become a stronger competitor than before. The original population has not changed, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population adapts to its new environment, they begin to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after a few thousand or even millions of years, these two populations will be so different that they can no longer be considered the same species. This process is called speciation, which means the creation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Hlavní orgán oběhového systému je srdce, které pumpuje krev. Krev opouští srdce v trubicích (cévách), kterým se říká tepny, a vrací se do něj v jiných, kterým se říká žíly. Nejmenší cévy označujeme jako vlásečnice (kapiláry).
mt: The heart is the main organ of the circulatory system, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart in tubes (vessels) called arteries, and returns to it in others, called veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries (capillaries).
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Hmyz byl prvními živočichy, kteří vzlétli do vzduchu. Jejich schopnost létat jim umožnila snadněji se vyhýbat nepřátelům a účinněji nacházet potravu a partnery. Většina hmyzu má tu výhodu, že svoje křídla může složit zpět podél těla. To jim poskytuje větší výběr malých prostor, kde se mohou skrývat před predátory. V dnešní době jsou jediným hmyzem, který nedokáže složit křídla, vážky a jepice.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly gave them an advantage in avoiding predators and finding food and mates. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings along their body. This gives them a greater choice of small spaces to hide in from predators. Today, only butterflies and moths are unable to fold their wings.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Mnoho paleontologů dnes věří, že jedna skupina dinosaurů přežila dodnes. Říkáme jim ptáci. Mnoho lidí o nich nepřemýšlí jako o dinosaurech, protože mají peří a umí létat. Na ptácích je ale stále spousta znaků, které připomínají dinosaury. Mají nohy s šupinami a drápy, snášejí vajíčka a chodí po svých dvou zadních nohách jako T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived to the present day. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But birds still have many signs that remind us of dinosaurs. They have legs with scales and claws, lay eggs, and walk on their two hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Zuby triceratopse byly schopny rozkousat nejen listy, ale také například tvrdé větve a kořeny. Někteří vědci si myslí, že Triceratopsové jedli cykasy, což je druh rostliny běžný pro období Křídy. Tyto rostliny vypadají jako malá palma s korunou ostrých a špičatých listů. Triceratops zřejmě používal silný zobák k tomu, aby z větví, jimiž se živil, nejprve stáhl listy. Jiní vědci tvrdí, že tyto rostliny jsou velmi jedovaté a tudíž je nepravděpodobné, že je dinosauři jedli, ačkoliv i v dnešní době může lenochod a další zvířata jako například papoušek (potomek dinosaurů) jíst jedovaté listy či ovoce.
mt: Triceratops teeth were able to bite not only leaves, but also for example hard branches and roots. Some scientists think that Triceratops ate cycads, which is a plant common for the Cretaceous period. These plants look like a small palm with a crown of sharp and pointed leaves. Triceratops probably used its strong beak to first pull off the leaves from the branches it fed on. Other scientists say that these plants are very poisonous and thus it is unlikely that dinosaurs ate them, although even in today's world a rhinoceros and other animals such as the parrot (a descendant of dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Italský národní fotbalový tým je společně s německým národním fotbalovým týmem druhým nejúspěšnějším týmem na světě a v roce 2006 Itálie vyhrála mistrovství světa ve fotbale. Mezi oblíbené sporty patří fotbal, basketbal, volejbal, vodní pólo, šerm, ragby, cyklistika, lední hokej, inline hokej a závody F1. Zimní sporty jsou velmi oblíbené v severních oblastech, kde Italové soutěží v mezinárodních hrách a olympijských kláních.
mt: The Italian national football team is second only to Germany in terms of success, and in 2006 Italy won the World Cup. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, cycling, ice hockey, inline hockey and Formula 1. Winter sports are very popular in the northern regions, where Italians compete in international games and Olympic competitions.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Lucembursko má dlouhou historii, jeho nezávislost se však datuje k roku 1839. Části dnešní Belgie byly v minulosti součástí Lucemburska, ale po belgické revoluci roku 1830 se staly součástí Belgie. Lucembursko se vždy snažilo zůstat neutrální zemí, ale v první i druhé světové válce bylo okupováno Německem. Lucembursko se v roce 1957 stalo zakládajícím členem organizace, která je dnes známá jako Evropská unie.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, its independence dating to 1839. Parts of today's Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but after the Belgian Revolution of 1830 became part of Belgium. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is today known as the European Union in 1957.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Lucembursko má dlouhou historii, jeho nezávislost se však datuje k roku 1839. Části dnešní Belgie byly v minulosti součástí Lucemburska, ale po belgické revoluci roku 1830 se staly součástí Belgie. Lucembursko se vždy snažilo zůstat neutrální zemí, ale v první i druhé světové válce bylo okupováno Německem. Lucembursko se v roce 1957 stalo zakládajícím členem organizace, která je dnes známá jako Evropská unie.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, its independence dating to 1839. Parts of today's Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but after the Belgian Revolution of 1830 became part of Belgium. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is today known as the European Union in 1957.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Evropské Turecko (východní Thrákie nebo také Rumélie na Balkánském poloostrově) tvoří 3 % země. Turecké území je více než 1 600 km (1 000 mil) dlouhé a 800 km (500 mil) široké a má přibližně tvar obdélníku. Oblast Turecka včetně jezer zabírá 783 562 čtverečních kilometrů (300 948 čtverečních mil), z nichž 755 688 čtverečních kilometrů (291 773 čtverečních mil) je v jihozápadní Asii a 23 764 čtverečních kilometrů (9 174 čtverečních mil) v Evropě. Rozloha činí z Turecka 37. největší zemi na světě. Je velké zhruba jako metropolitní Francie a Spojené království dohromady. Turecko je omýváno mořem ze tří stran: Egejským mořem na západě, Černým mořem na severu a Středozemním mořem na jihu.
mt: 3% of Turkey (Eastern Thrace or also Rumelia on the Balkan Peninsula) is in Europe. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 km (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide and has roughly the shape of a rectangle. The area of Turkey including lakes covers 783,562 square kilometers (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometers (291,773 square miles) is in southwestern Asia and 23,764 square kilometers (9,174 square miles) in Europe. The area makes Turkey the 37th largest country in the world. It is about as large as metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is washed by the sea from three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Populace Vatikánu zahrnuje okolo 800 obyvatel. Je to nejmenší nezávislá země na světě a země s nejnižší populací. Vatikán ve svých právních předpisech a úředních sděleních používá italštinu. Italština je také každodenním jazykem používaným většinou těch, kteří pracují ve státě, zatímco latina je často používána v náboženských obřadech. Všichni občané Vatikánu jsou římskokatolického vyznání.
mt: The population of Vatican City includes about 800 residents. It is the smallest independent state in the world and the state with the lowest population. Italian is used in the Vatican's legal codes and official documents. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are of the Roman Catholic faith.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Videa i obrázky mohou být v současné době počítačově upraveny. Na počítači mohou být vytvořeny propracovanější animace, a ty jsou stále více využívány pro televizi a film. Hudba je často nahrávána pomocí sofistikovaných počítačů, které zpracovávají a mixují zvuky.
mt: Videos and images can be computer enhanced. On a computer, more sophisticated animations can be created, and these are increasingly used for television and film. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers that process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Města Harappa a Mohendžodaro měla splachovací toaletu v téměř každém domě, připojenou na sofistikovaný odpadní systém. Pozůstatky systémů odvodu odpadních vod byly nalezeny v minojských městech na Krétě a Santorini v Řecku. Záchody měli i ve starém Egyptě, Persii a Číně. Ve starém Římě byly záchody občas součástí veřejných lázní, které navštěvovali muži i ženy společně.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had flush toilets in almost every house, connected to a sophisticated sewage system. The remains of sewage systems were found in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. Toilets were also used in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In ancient Rome, toilets were sometimes part of public baths, which were attended by men and women together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Čepel moderní brusle má dvojí ostří s konkávní dutinou mezi nimi. Dvojitá hrana umožňuje lepší přilnavost k ledu i při náklonu. Protože je spodní část čepele lehce zakřivená, jak se čepel naklání na jednu nebo druhou stranu, je ostří, které se dostane do kontaktu s ledem, také zakřivené. To umožňuje bruslaři zatáčet. Pokud se brusle nakloní směrem doprava, bruslař zatáčí vpravo, zatímco náklon doleva bruslaři dovolí zatočit vlevo.
mt: The modern ice skate blade has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The double edge allows better grip on ice even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge that comes into contact with the ice is also curved. This allows the skater to turn. If the skate tilts to the right, the skater turns right, while tilting to the left allows the skater to turn left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Aby se vrátily na svou předchozí úroveň energie, musí se zbavit energie navíc, kterou získaly ze světla. Dělají to vyzařováním malé částice světla zvané „foton“. Vědci tento proces nazývají „stimulovanou emisí záření“, protože dochází ke stimulování atomů jasným světlem, což způsobuje emise fotonu světla, a světlo je typem záření. Následující obrázek ukazuje, jak atomy vydávají fotony. Ve skutečnosti jsou fotony samozřejmě o hodně menší než ty na obrázku. Fotony jsou ještě menší než částice, které tvoří atomy!
mt: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they gained from light. They do this by emitting a small particle of light called a "photon". Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation", because the atoms are stimulated by bright light to emit a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The following picture shows how atoms emit photons. In reality, photons are actually much smaller than the particles that make up atoms!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Po stovkách hodin činnosti nakonec náplň v žárovce vyhoří a žárovka již nesvítí. Poté potřebuje žárovka vyměnit. Při výměně žárovky je třeba postupovat opatrně. Nejprve je nutné vypnout vypínač svítidla nebo odpojit kabel. Je to proto, že elektřina proudící do patice, kde je umístěna kovová část žárovky, může způsobit vážný úraz elektrickým proudem, pokud se dotknete vnitřní části zásuvky nebo kovové základny žárovky, zatímco je stále částečně v patici
mt: After hundreds of hours of operation, the filament eventually burns out and the bulb no longer glows. At this point, the bulb needs to be replaced. When replacing the bulb, it is important to proceed carefully. First, it is necessary to turn off the switch of the light fixture or disconnect the cable. This is because the electricity flowing into the socket, where the metal part of the bulb is located, can cause serious electrical shock if you touch the internal part of the socket or the metal base of the bulb, while it is still partially in the socket
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Štěpná jaderná bomba funguje na principu, že k udržení jádra s mnoha protony a neutrony pohromadě je zapotřebí energie. Je to něco jako vézt těžký vozík do kopce. Znovurozdělením atomového jádra se pak část této energie uvolní. Některé atomy mají nestabilní jádra, což znamená, že mají tendenci rozpadnout se při jemném či dokonce žádném kontaktu.
mt: A fission nuclear bomb works on the principle that to keep a core with many protons and neutrons together requires energy. It is like pushing a heavy cart up a hill. By reassembling the atomic core, some of this energy is then released. Some atoms have unstable cores, meaning that they tend to break down when touched even lightly or not at all.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Voláte-li někomu, kdo je tisíce kilometrů daleko, využíváte k hovoru satelit. Satelit ve vesmíru obdrží hovor a poté jeho signál odrazí téměř okamžitě zpět dolů. Satelit byl do vesmíru vynesen pomocí rakety. Vědci využívají vesmírné teleskopy, protože zemská atmosféra nám částečně zkresluje světlo a zorné pole. K vynesení satelitu nebo teleskopu do vesmíru je zapotřebí veliké rakety, která měří přes 100 stop.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite to make the call. The satellite in space receives the call and then reflects the signal back down almost immediately. The satellite was launched into space using a rocket. Scientists use space telescopes because the Earth's atmosphere distorts light and the field of view. To launch a satellite or telescope into space requires a large rocket that is over 100 feet long.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Čas je něco, co se nachází všude kolem nás a ovlivňuje všechno, co děláme, ale je složité mu porozumět. Čas je předmětem studia náboženských, filozofických a vědeckých učenců již po tisíce let. Čas vnímáme jako řadu zážitků, které plynou od budoucnosti skrz přítomnost až do minulosti. Čas je také způsobem, kterým porovnáváme dobu trvání (délku) událostí. Běh času můžete zaznamenávat i vy na základě pozorování toho, jak se opakuje nějaká cyklická událost. To znamená něco, co se pravidelně stává znovu a znovu.
mt: Time is something that is all around us and affects everything we do, but it is difficult to understand. Time has been the subject of study by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We perceive time as a series of experiences that flow from the future through the present to the past. Time is also a way of comparing the duration (length) of events. You can also record the flow of time based on observing how some cyclical event repeats itself. This means something that happens again and again in a regular pattern.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Čas je něco, co se nachází všude kolem nás a ovlivňuje všechno, co děláme, ale je složité mu porozumět. Čas je předmětem studia náboženských, filozofických a vědeckých učenců již po tisíce let. mt: Time is something that is all around us and affects everything we do, but it is difficult to understand. Time has been the subject of study by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We perceive time as a series of experiences that flow from the future through the present to the past. Time is also a way of comparing the duration (length) of events. You can also record the flow of time based on observing how some cyclical event repeats itself. This means something that happens again and again in a regular pattern.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Podle tradice nastupuje dědic trůnu po škole do armády. Charles nicméně začal navštěvovat Trinity College na univerzitě v Cambridge, kde studoval antropologii a archeologii, později pak historii (získal zde bakalářský titul). Charles byl prvním členem Britské královské rodiny, který získal vysokoškolský titul.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne attends school before joining the army. Charles, however, began attending Trinity College at the University of Cambridge, where he studied anthropology and archaeology, later history (earning a bachelor's degree there). Charles was the first member of the British royal family to earn a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Po znovudobytí Danelaw zažila Anglie dlouhé období míru. Nicméně v roce 991 čelil Ethelred největší vikingské flotile od doby Guthruma o sto let dříve. Flotilu vedl Olaf Trygvasson, Nor s ambicemi získat zpět svou zemi z dánské nadvlády. Po počátečních vojenských nezdarech byl Ethelred schopen dosáhnout dohody s Olafem, který se vrátil do Norska a se smíšenými úspěchy se pokoušel získat své království.
mt: After the re-conquest of the Danelaw, England enjoyed a long period of peace. However, in 991, Ethelred faced the largest Viking fleet since the time of Guthrum a century earlier. The fleet was led by Olaf Tryggvason, a Norwegian with ambitions to regain his country from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to negotiate a deal with Olaf, who returned to Norway and with mixed success sought to regain his kingdom.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: Okolo 15. století byl sever Estonska pod velkým kulturním vlivem Německa. Někteří němečtí mniši chtěli Boha přiblížit místním obyvatelům, a tak vynalezli estonský psaný jazyk. Jazyk byl založen na německé abecedě a byl přidán jeden znak „Õ/õ“. Postupem času řada slov vypůjčených z němčiny splynula. To bylo počátkem osvícení.
mt: 15th century, the north of Estonia was under a great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local people, so they invented the Estonian written language. The language was based on the German alphabet and was added one sign „Õ/õ“. Over time, many words borrowed from German merged. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Odhady počtu lidí, kteří mluví hindštinou, se liší. Odhaduje se, že jde o druhý až čtvrtý nejčastěji používaný jazyk na světě. Počet rodilých mluvčích se liší v závislosti na tom, zda započítáme velmi blízká nářečí, nebo nikoliv. Odhady jsou v rozmezí 340 milionů až 500 milionů mluvčích a až 800 milionů lidí dokáže jazyku rozumět. Hindština a urdština mají podobnou slovní zásobu, ale liší se písmem; v každodenních konverzacích si mluvčí obou jazyků obvykle rozumí.
mt: Estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi vary. It is estimated to be the second or third most spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether very closely related dialects are counted or not. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers and up to 800 million people who understand it. Hindi and Urdu have a similar vocabulary, but differ in writing system; in everyday conversations speakers of both languages usually understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangeul je jediná záměrně vymyšlená abeceda, která se dnes aktivně používá. Abeceda byla vynalezena v roce 1444 za vlády krále Sejonga (1418–1450). Král Sejong byl čtvrtým králem dynastie Joseon a je jedním z nejvíce uznávaných. Král písmo hangul původně nazýval Hunmin Jeongeum, což znamená „správné zvuky pro příkazy lidu.“
mt: Hangul is the only alphabet ever intentionally created. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty and is one of the most respected. The king originally called the Hangul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means “proper sounds for the commands of the people.”
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Existuje mnoho teorií, jak vznikl sanskrt. Jedna z nich se zabývá árijskou migrací ze západu do Indie, během níž si s sebou lidé přinesli svůj jazyk. Sanskrt je starověký jazyk srovnatelný s latinou používanou v Evropě. Nejstarší známá kniha na světě byla napsána v sanskrtu. Po vzniku upanišad však význam sanskrtu poklesl v důsledku hierarchie. Sanskrt je velmi složitý a bohatý jazyk, který sloužil jako zdroj mnoha moderních indických jazyků, stejně jako latina je zdrojem pro evropské jazyky včetně francouzštiny a španělštiny.
mt: There are many theories about the origin of Sanskrit. One of them deals with the Aryan migration from the west to India, during which people brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language comparable to Latin used in Europe. The oldest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the creation of the Upanishads, however, the importance of Sanskrit declined due to the hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language that served as a source for many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source for European languages including French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Jak by mě přitahovala gravitace měsíce Io? Pokud byste stáli na povrchu Io, vážili byste méně než na Zemi. Člověk, který na zemi váží 200 liber (90 kg), by na měsíci Io vážil asi 36 liber (16 kg). Gravitace je tudíž pochopitelně méně citelná.
mt: How would I be attracted by the gravity of the moon Io? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than on Earth. A man who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on the moon Io. Gravity is therefore understandable.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Povrch Měsíce je složen ze skal a prachu. Vnější vrstvě Měsíce se říká krusta. Kůra je silná přibližně 70 km na přivrácené straně a okolo 100 km na odvrácené straně. Pod moři je slabší a pod pohořími zase silnější. Na bližší straně se může nacházet více měsíčních moří, protože kůra je zde tenčí. Láva se tak mohla snadněji dostat na povrch.
mt: The surface of the Moon is composed of rock and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and about 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the seas and thicker under the mountains. There may be more lunar seas on the near side, because the crust is thinner there. Lava could have more easily reached the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Mnoho lidí sní o dni, kdy budou lidé mít možnost cestovat k jiným hvězdám a prozkoumat jiné světy. Někteří lidé přemýšlejí, co se tam nachází. Někteří věří, že na jiné planetě mohou žít mimozemšťané nebo existovat jiný život. Ale pokud se to někdy stane, pravděpodobně to bude až za velmi dlouho. Hvězdy jsou rozprostřeny tak, že mezi sousedními hvězdami jsou biliony kilometrů. Možná budou vaši pravnuci jednoho dne stát v mimozemském světě a přemýšlet o tom, kdo byli jejich dávní předkové?
mt: Many people dream of a day when people will be able to travel to other stars and explore other worlds. Some people wonder what is there. Some believe that aliens may live on another planet or that other life exists. But if this ever happens, it will probably be very long from now. Stars are spread out so that between neighboring stars are billions of kilometers. Maybe your great-grandchildren will one day stand in an alien world and wonder who their ancient ancestors were?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Slunce nemá na rozdíl od Země krustu, na které by se dalo stát. Celé Slunce je utvořeno z plynů, ohně a plasmy. Se zvyšující se vzdáleností od středu Slunce jsou plyny řidší. Vnější část, kterou při pohledu na Slunce vidíme, se nazývá fotosféra, což znamená „koule světla“.
mt: The Sun does not have a crust, like the Earth, on which one can stand. The entire Sun is made of gases, fire, and plasma. With increasing distance from the center of the Sun, the gases are less dense. The outer part, which we see when looking at the Sun, is called the photosphere, which means "sphere of light".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Po přibližně třech tisíciletích, v roce 1610, použil italský astronom Galileo Galilei dalekohled k pozorování Venuše: zjistil, že má podobně jako Měsíc různé fáze. Fáze se dějí jen proto, že osvětlena je jen část Venuše (nebo Měsíce), která je obrácená ke Slunci. Fáze Venuše podporovaly Koperníkovu teorii, že planety obíhají kolem Slunce. Anglický astronom Jeremiah Horrocks pak o několik let později v roce 1639 pozoroval tzv. přechod Venuše.
mt: 3,000 years ago, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe Venus: he found that it had phases like the Moon. Phases happen only because only part of Venus (or the Moon) is illuminated by the Sun. The phases of Venus supported Copernicus' theory that planets orbit the Sun. English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks then a few years later in 1639 observed the transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazonka je největší a druhá nejdelší řeka na Zemi. Protéká jí více než osmkrát více vody než druhou největší řekou. Amazonka je také nejširší řekou na Zemi, v některých místech je až šest mil široká. Celých 20 procent vody, která vytéká z řek naší planety do oceánů, pochází z Amazonky. Hlavní tok Amazonky je dlouhý 6 387 km (3 980 mil). Sbírá vodu z tisíců menších řek.
mt: The Amazon is the largest and second longest river on Earth. More water flows through it than through the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, in some places it is six miles wide. Twenty percent of the water that flows out of the rivers of our planet into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main channel of the Amazon is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Osmnáct procent Venezuelců je nezaměstnaných a většina zaměstnaných pracuje v šedé ekonomice. Dvě třetiny zaměstnaných Venezuelců pracují v sektoru služeb, téměř čtvrtina pracuje v průmyslu, pětina pak v zemědělství. Pro Venezuelu je důležitý ropný průmysl, v němž je země čistým vývozcem, i když v tomto odvětví pracuje jen jedno procento populace.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed and most of the employed work in the grey economy. Two thirds of employed Venezuelans work in the service sector, almost a quarter work in industry, and a fifth in agriculture. For Venezuela, the oil industry is important, in which the country is a net exporter, although in this sector only one percent of the population works.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Hvězdy vydávají světlo a teplo následkem energie, která vzniká spojováním (neboli fúzí) atomů vodíku, čímž vznikají těžší prvky. Vědci pracují na vytvoření reaktoru, který dokáže stejným způsobem vyrábět energii. Řešení tohoto problému je však velmi náročné a potrvá mnoho let, než dojde ke stavbě použitelných fúzních reaktorů.
mt: Stars emit light and heat as a result of energy created by fusing (or combining) atoms of hydrogen, which creates heavier elements. Scientists are working on creating a reactor that can do the same thing. However, solving this problem is very difficult and will take many years before usable fusion reactors are built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Prvky a sloučeniny mohou přecházet z jednoho skupenství do druhého beze změny. Plynný dusík má shodné vlastnosti jako dusík v kapalném skupenství. Jako kapalina má vyšší hustotu, avšak molekuly zůstávají stejné. Jiným příkladem je voda. Voda se coby sloučenina skládá ze dvou atomů vodíku a jednoho atomu kyslíku. Má stejnou molekulární strukturu bez ohledu na to, zda je ve skupenství plynném, kapalném nebo pevném. Ačkoliv se fyzický stav může měnit, chemická podoba zůstává stejná.
mt: Substances and compounds can change from one state of matter to another without changing. Gaseous nitrogen has the same properties as nitrogen in the liquid state. As a liquid, it has a higher density, but the molecules remain the same. Another example is water. Water, as a compound, is made up of two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen. It has the same molecular structure regardless of whether it is in the gaseous, liquid, or solid state. Although the physical state may change, the chemical composition remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Během války za nezávislost třináct států nejprve zformovalo slabou centrální vládu, kdy Kongres byl její jedinou složkou, spadající pod Články Konfederace. Kongresu scházela moc k uvalení daní, a protože neexistoval žádný národní výkonný či soudní orgán, spoléhal v prosazování zákonů na státní orgány, které často nespolupracovaly. Rovněž nemělo žádnou pravomoc zrušit daňové zákony a tarify mezi státy. Články vyžadovaly jednomyslný souhlas všech států a teprve poté mohly být  doplněny. Státy braly centrální vládu na lehkou váhu, a to natolik, že jejich zástupci často nebyli přítomni.
mt: During the War of Independence, thirteen states first formed a weak central government, with Congress being its sole branch, falling under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked the power to levy taxes, and since there was no national executive or judicial branch, it relied on state governments to enforce laws, which often did not cooperate. It also lacked the power to repeal tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent of all states before they could be amended. States took the central government lightly, to the point that their representatives often were not present.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Pokud jste viděli film Lovci pokladů, možná si myslíte, že na zadní straně Deklarace nezávislosti byla nakreslena mapa k pokladu. To však není pravda. Přestože je vzadu na dokumentu něco napsáno, není to mapa k pokladu. Na zadní straně Deklarace nezávislosti se nacházejí slova „Originál Deklarace nezávislosti ze dne 4. července 1776“. Text je na spodní straně dokumentu, napsaný vzhůru nohama. I když autor není s určitostí známý, je zřejmé, že velký pergamenový dokument (rozměry 29¾ x 24½ palců) byl nedlouho po svém vytvoření stočen do role a uskladněn. Je tedy pravděpodobné, že byl zápis přidán jednoduše jako přílepek.
mt: If you've seen the movie National Treasure, you might think that the back of the Declaration of Independence was drawn with a map to the treasure. That's not true. Although there is something written on the back of the Declaration of Independence, it's not a map to the treasure. On the back of the Declaration of Independence are the words "Original Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776." The text is on the bottom of the document, written upside down. Although the author is not known for certain, it is clear that the large parchment document (29¾ x 24½ inches) was folded into a roll and stored shortly after its creation. It is therefore likely that the inscription was simply added as a sticker.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Brzy po nezávislosti země pomohly singapurské botanické zahrady přeměnit ostrov ve město tropických zahrad. V roce 1981 byla hybridní orchidej Vanda Miss Joaquim vybrána jako národní květina.
mt: Soon after independence, Singapore's botanical gardens helped transform the island into a city of tropical gardens. In 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Brzy po nezávislosti země pomohly singapurské botanické zahrady přeměnit ostrov ve město tropických zahrad. V roce 1981 byla hybridní orchidej Vanda Miss Joaquim vybrána jako národní květina.
mt: Soon after independence, Singapore's botanical gardens helped transform the island into a city of tropical gardens. In 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Přestože stavění kamenných pyramid pokračovalo až do konce Staré říše, pyramidy v Gíze nikdy nebyly překonány ani ve velikosti, ani v technické preciznosti výstavby. Starověcí Egypťané z Nové říše žasli nad památkami svých předků, které byly v té době více než tisíc let staré.
mt: Although construction of stone pyramids continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids at Giza were never surpassed in size or technical precision of construction. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom were awed by the monuments of their ancestors, which were by then more than a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Každý rok kolem října cestuje téměř 1,5 milionu býložravců po jižních pláních, překročí řeku Mara a během dešťů se usazují v severních kopcích. A poté zpátky na sever přes západ, opět s překročením řeky Mara, poté co okolo dubna skončí deště. Region Serengeti zahrnuje národní park Serengeti, chráněnou oblast Ngorongoro, rezervaci na ochranu zvěře Maswa v Tanzanii a národní rezervaci Maasai Mara v Keni.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores travel south each October, cross the Mara River and settle in the northern hills during the rainy season. And then back north across the west, again crossing the Mara River, after the rains end around April. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, the Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Když skončila bitva o Francii, Německo se začalo připravovat k invazi na Britský ostrov. Německo útok označilo jako „operaci Seelöwe“. Většina těžkých zbraní a zásob britské armády byla ztracena při evakuaci z Dunkerque, takže armáda byla poměrně slabá. Královské námořnictvo však bylo stále mnohem silnější než německé námořnictvo („Kriegsmarine“) a mohlo zničit jakoukoli útočnou flotilu vyslanou přes Lamanšský průliv. Velmi málo lodí Královského námořnictva však bylo rozestavěno poblíž nejpravděpodobnějších tras invaze, protože admirálové se obávali, že by je potopil německý vzdušný útok.
mt: When the Battle of France ended, Germany began preparing for an invasion of the British island. Germany called the attack "Operation Seelöwe". Most of the heavy weapons and supplies of the British army were lost during the evacuation of Dunkirk, so the army was relatively weak. The Royal Navy, however, was still much stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could destroy any attacking fleet sent across the English Channel. Very few ships of the Royal Navy were stationed near the most likely invasion routes, because the admirals feared that the German air attack would sink them.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
